https://www.linkedin.com/company/startup.text:
The Startup Policy Forum has unveiled #100DesiDeepTechs, a national initiative to spotlight and support 100 standout deep-tech startups. With support from DPIIT’s Startup India, MeitY Startup Hub, and IIT Madras, the selected ventures will gain access to closed-door policy dialogues with top regulators, investors, and academia. 

Covering critical tech areas such as EVs, biotech, defence, and AI, the program includes a mentor board and culminates in a comprehensive policy whitepaper. 

This initiative reflects India’s growing commitment to innovation-driven growth, backed by dedicated funds like the ₹1 Lakh Cr RDI Scheme and the Deep-Tech Fund of Funds.

Read more: https://bit.ly/4lpjLP1  

Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade

Shri Sanjiv | Shri Sumeet Jarangal

#StartupIndia #DPIIT #StartupNews #Innovation

At the Matrix Global Summit, TiE Bangalore unveiled a compelling vision: over 50% of Indian startups by 2035 will emerge from Tier 2 and 3 cities. The report, backed by 60+ ecosystem leaders, urges a transition from metro-led growth to ‘Entrepreneurial Bharat’. It proposes integrating entrepreneurship into 75% of secondary schools and fostering innovation clusters in every district. 

With targeted policy reforms and bold research goals, it charts a path to 50 Mn jobs and 100+ Indian startups going global. India’s startup map is being redrawn, and it’s more inclusive, ambitious, and decentralised than ever before.

Read more: https://bit.ly/4lFxy3x  

Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade

Shri Sanjiv | Shri Sumeet Jarangal

#StartupIndia #DPIIT #StartupNews #Innovation

The Government of India has approved the ₹1 Lakh Cr Research Development and Innovation (RDI) Scheme to strengthen research and technology in critical sectors. 

Announced by the Hon’ble Prime Minister’s Cabinet, the scheme will offer long-term loans at minimal interest rates, unlocking funding for private enterprises and startups. With a dual-layer funding structure and governance by ANRF, the scheme supports innovation at high Technology Readiness Levels and facilitates tech acquisition of strategic importance. As India advances towards Viksit Bharat by 2047, the RDI Scheme is a bold step towards global competitiveness and inclusive innovation.

Read more: https://bit.ly/4lEs35l 

Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade

Shri Sanjiv | Shri Sumeet Jarangal

#StartupIndia #DPIIT #StartupNews #Innovation

Calling Women Entrepreneurs in MedTech & CleanTech!
IKP EDEN is excited to announce an Ask Us Anything (AUA) session for BioXcelerate – a flagship program under the WEscalate Initiative powered by K-tech Biotechnology Facilitation Cell Karnataka Innovation and Technology Society IT BT Department, Karnataka.

BioXcelerate offers a structured 6-month incubation phase followed by a 6-month acceleration phase, with a clear focus on translating high-potential science into scalable and sustainable ventures.

Date: 11th July at 6 PM
Location - IKP EDEN (Maps: goo.gl/ur42sk)
Registration Link for AUA - https://lnkd.in/gvH_RGJs
Click here to apply for the program - https://lnkd.in/gDeybQHM (Last date to apply : 26th July, 2025)

This is an excellent opportunity for women entrepreneurs working in MedTech, CleanTech, and allied sectors to learn more about the program and explore how it can support your growth journey.

Join us to ask your questions, gain clarity, and take the next big step in your entrepreneurial journey.
Stay tuned for more updates!

𝐎𝐧𝐞 𝐖𝐨𝐫𝐥𝐝. 𝐎𝐧𝐞 𝐇𝐞𝐚𝐥𝐭𝐡. 𝐏𝐫𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐙𝐨𝐨𝐧𝐨𝐬𝐞𝐬.

Following World Zoonoses Day observed on July 6th, we’re spotlighting dengue — one of the fastest-growing mosquito-borne diseases globally, with over 𝟔.𝟕 𝐦𝐢𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐜𝐚𝐬𝐞𝐬 reported in 2023 alone as per World Health Organization.

From climate change to rapid urbanisation, the spread of zoonotic diseases calls for a united response rooted in science, innovation, and collaboration.

At IKP, we're not just observing zoonotic threats—we’re supporting solutions that reaffirm our commitment to climate-smart health systems and global collaborations where surveillance, science, and startups converge.

Let's innovate to prevent.

To collaborate with us, write to: engage@ikpknowledgepark.com 

And don't forget to follow IKP for more on health, science, and impact.

#WorldZoonosesDay #OneWorldOneHealth #PreventZoonoses #GlobalHealth #DengueAwareness #InnovationForImpact #OneHealth #VectorBorneDiseases

We are constantly inspired by purpose-driven solutions that tackle critical public health challenges at the grassroots.
 
Bengaluru-based Janitri Innovations, an IKP-supported, startup quietly transforming maternal and newborn health through frugal innovation, is a powerful reminder that big change often begins with small, thoughtful steps.
 
We celebrate ventures that combine empathy and engineering to create scalable, life-saving interventions.
 
Janitri is supported by programs like AGC JanCARE, a part of our portfolio, and is incubated at IKP EDEN. As ecosystem enablers, stories like these reinforce our belief in nurturing science and technology for inclusive growth.

https://www.linkedin.com/company/biotech.text:
On #WorldBioproductDay 2025, the ‘One Nation, One Day, One Hour per City’ dialogue series brought together powerful voices to shape the future of India’s bioeconomy.

BIRAC led a compelling session on Industry–Academia partnerships — a cornerstone of India's thriving biotech landscape. With the esteemed presence of Hon’ble Union Minister Dr Jitendra Singh, DBT Secretary Dr. Rajesh Gokhale, BIRAC MD Dr. Jitendra Kumar and Dr. Alka Sharma the dialogue emphasized innovation, collaboration, and the collective drive toward sustainable growth.

The session concluded with Dr Jitendra Singh reaffirming India's ambition to become the torchbearer of a Green Revolution Ecosystem — one powered by biomanufacturing, circular economy principles, and the transformative vision of the BioE3 policy.

This year, the spotlight was on some of India’s most promising biotech startups, nurtured by BIRAC and supported through BioNEST incubators.

🔬 ImmunoACT – Dr. Shirish Arya
Developed India’s first homegrown CAR-T cell therapy, revolutionizing cancer treatment.

🍬 Revelations Biotech Pvt. Ltd. – Dr. Beeram Ravi Chandra 
Introduced the world’s first low-cost, indigenous sugar substitutes.

🧪 K Cat Enzymatics – Dr. Praveen Kumar
Crafting enzyme technologies to address industrial, medical, and environmental issues.

🩹 Fibroheal Woundcare Pvt Ltd – Dr. Vivek Mishra
Invented FIBROPLUG, a patented wound-care solution that ensures rapid clotting and protection.

🧫 OmniBRx Biotechnologies Pvt Ltd - Ravindra Patel 
Pioneering cost-efficient bioreactor platforms for vaccines and biologics.

🌱 Cell Biology & Hydroponics – Dr. Vishal Warke
Driving advanced R&D in affordable serum-free, chemically defined media and feed supplements for therapeutic proteins.

🌾 Balrampur Chini Mills Limited – Ms. Avantika Saraogi 
Spearheading India’s first PLA bioplastics plant — a leap toward green, renewable, and circular biomanufacturing.

📢 The event also featured dynamic Student Innovator Pitches:

Sudhanshu Kumar, Chinmoy Dan, Ishika Roy — BioBulb: A microalgae-powered device that purifies air by removing CO₂ and airborne toxins.

Vaishnavi Sharma — A sustainable solution using biochar from fruit peels to remove heavy metals from wastewater.

Together, these voices, innovations, and commitments are powering India's bio-revolution — the BioE3 Way.

Jitendra Kumar I Chhaya Chauhan I Dr. Sujit Das I Kanupriya Vashishth

#WorldBioproductDay #BioE3Way #BIRAC #DBTIndia #StartupIndia #ScienceForSociety #MakeInIndia #Bioeconomy #InnovationLeadership #AtmanirbharBiotech #StudentInnovators #CityPledge

Celebrating #WorldBioproductDay: the #BioE3 way!

On this occasion, we solemn pledge to make India the torchbearer of Green Revolution Ecosystem fostering economic growth through Biomanufacturing and Circulatory channels …aligning with BioE3 policy.

Dr Jitendra Singh | Rajesh Gokhale
The last date is approaching soon!

Glimpses from the India Antimicrobial Resistance (AMR) Innovation Workshop!

The event featured an Innovation Spotlight of breakthrough innovations supported by CCAMP, under the India AMR Innovation Hub (IAIH), including Pocket PCR devices, air sterilisation systems, and paper-based lateral flow tests (LFTs). 

Innovators had the opportunity to interact directly with stakeholders, receiving vital feedback and collaborations.

#IndiaFightsAMR
........
Office of the Principal Scientific Adviser to the Government of India
Taslimarif Saiyed, PhD Dr Jitendra Singh, ICMR, 
Department of Health and Family Welfare Services - Govt. of Karnataka Priyank M Kharge, Dinesh Gundu Rao, Dr. Ekroop Caur, IT BT Department, Karnataka, National Centre for Disease Control

CARB-X Global Antibiotic R&D Partnership (GARDP) FIND Gates Foundation Wellcome Trust Novo Nordisk Foundation SBI Foundation The International Centre for Antimicrobial Resistance Solutions (ICARS) World Health Organization Department of Health and Social Care 

Rajesh Gokhale Department of Biotechnology Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC) Department of Science & Technology, Government of India Startup India Startup Karnataka NITI Aayog Official Atal Innovation Mission Official , Anand Anandkumar

Glimpses from the India Antimicrobial Resistance (AMR) Innovation Workshop! 

Panel Discussion III, titled “Exploring Synergies Between Global Ecosystems to Fast-track Contextual Innovations in AMR for India,” brought together key global stakeholders to explore how international partnerships can accelerate locally relevant AMR solutions. 

The discussion highlighted the importance of conducting diagnostic capability assessment studies and noted how deployment locations can act as learning sites. The speakers underscored the need for indigenous development of raw materials to reduce costs and called for faster, more coordinated partnerships to fund and guide AMR innovations.

Moderated by Dr Swati Subodh from CCAMP, the panellists were 
Dr. Chitra Pattabiraman: Gates Foundation   
Dr. Jaideep Gogtay: Cipla  
Mr. Karan Prabhakar: Global Antibiotic R&D Partnership (GARDP)
Dr. Jakob Williams Ørberg: Novo Nordisk Foundation India

The final session, titled “Global Best Practices from Innovation-Focused Programs for India’s AMR Needs,” focused on how global strategies can be adapted to India’s unique AMR landscape. "Innovations need to be fungible, feasible, reproducible, sustainable, and timely", they noted and stressed the need to standardise and contextualise antibiotic breakpoints specifically for India. 

The speakers proposed the development of a comprehensive map to understand the ecosystem and who the key players in the country are.
They also highlighted the importance of assessing the market landscape, including its size, opportunities, and commercialisation potential, to enable an impact-driven AMR innovation ecosystem.

Moderated by CCAMP Dir- CEO Dr Taslimarif Saiyed, PhD, the panellists were:
Dr. Ghada Zoubiane: LifeArc
Mr. Anmol A.: Venus Remedies Limited 
Mr. Harkesh Dabas: Clinton Health Access Initiative, Inc.
Dr. Guru Rajesh Jammy: The World Bank

#IndiaFightsAMR
.......

👀 A little hint. A lot of excitement.
 Something big is on its way from the hills! ⛰️🌄
 Are you ready?

Dipankar Deb | Satvasheel Powar | Anil Singh | Gaurav P. | Harish Kanaujia | Salik Sarwar | Manish Singh | Ravinder Kumar | vishal sharma | Minni Kaur | Kushal Deep Jagota | Lipsa Rani Panda

#IITMandiCatalyst  #IITMandi #Incubator #Startups #Innovation #StartupInHills #StartupIndia #InnovationEcosystem #Entrepreneurship

IIT Mandi Catalyst recently organized a focused workshop titled Investment Outreach’ for its incubated startups, led by Vikrant Potnis, Founder of Fundenable, for a deep-dive session into the realities of fundraising and startup scale-up in India. With a rich background in investment banking and venture capital, Vikrant shared powerful insights on:

💡 The three pillars of fundraising:
 ✔️ Fundability
 ✔️ Technical process
 ✔️ Investor access

🔍 He also presented case studies from successful Fundenable portfolio startups like EMotorad, WorkIndia, and SuperBottoms, illustrating how strategic funding and strong execution drive exponential growth.

✨ A big thank you to Vikrant for empowering our startup founders with clarity, structure, and investor-ready wisdom!

Dipankar Deb | Satvasheel Powar | Anil Singh | Gaurav P. | Harish Kanaujia | Salik Sarwar | Manish Singh | Ravinder Kumar | vishal sharma | Minni Kaur | Kushal Deep Jagota | Lipsa Rani Panda

#IITMandiCatalyst  #IITMandi #catalyst #Incubator #incubatees #startups #innovation #StartupInHills #Fundenable #StartupIndia #Fundraising #VentureCapital

👏 Startup Spotlight | SmartEye – Empowering the Visually Impaired
We’re proud to share that Smart Eye SmartEye, a portfolio startup of IIT Mandi Catalyst, is making remarkable strides with its innovation, PathPal – a smart blind stick designed to enhance mobility for the visually impaired.

Recently, the PathPal prototype underwent extensive user testing across multiple blind schools, where users explored the device in real-world settings. The team received valuable feedback and built trust within the community—ensuring the product truly meets user needs.

🔍 About SmartEye:
 SmartEye operates in the assistive technology space within the healthtech sector, developing intelligent solutions using ultrasonic sensors and AI/ML algorithms to solve navigation challenges for the visually impaired.

We’re excited to see how SmartEye continues to make a real-world impact! 🌍💡

Dipankar Deb | Satvasheel Powar | Anil Singh | Gaurav P. | Harish Kanaujia | Salik Sarwar | Manish Singh | Ravinder Kumar | vishal sharma | Minni Kaur | Kushal Deep Jagota | Lipsa Rani Panda
KANIKA SHARMA | Abhimanyu Gulati

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗯𝗲𝗴𝗮𝗻 𝗮𝘀 𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗻𝗲𝗱 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗼 𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻!
At Hands-on 𝟯𝗗 𝗣𝗿𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀𝗵𝗼𝗽, conducted by MaDeIT Innovation Foundation - IIITDM, participants — including excited school children — stepped into the world of additive manufacturing. From exploring 𝗙𝗗𝗠 𝗽𝗿𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀 and 𝗹𝗮𝘀𝗲𝗿 𝗰𝘂𝘁𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀 to designing and 𝗽𝗿𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗶𝗿 𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗶𝗿𝘀𝘁 𝗺𝗼𝗱𝗲𝗹𝘀, the day was packed with learning, making, and pure joy.

A powerful introduction to digital fabrication and maker culture, sparking young minds to dream, design, and build.

🎓 Academia Meets Innovation at DERBI Foundation! 🧠🚀

We were delighted to welcome faculty members from the Dayananda Sagar Business Academy as part of a Faculty Development Program (FDP) aimed at bridging the gap between academic knowledge and entrepreneurial application.

The session included an engaging walkthrough of DERBI Foundation’s lab and Dayananda Sagar University's innovation campus at Kudlu Gate, where faculty had the opportunity to experience the startup ecosystem up close, from ideation spaces to prototyping labs, and incubation support facilities.

The visit sparked meaningful conversations around how real-world problem-solving, startup exposure, and innovation-driven thinking can be brought into the classroom to better prepare students for tomorrow’s challenges.

We look forward to more such academia-industry interactions that nurture a stronger entrepreneurial culture on campuses! 🌱💡

Dr.Premachandra Sagar | Rohan Prem Sagar | Sathyanarayana B V | Bhavani G | Daamini Sharma | Dr. Adithya Hande

Dr. Madanagopal toured our incubation and innovation infrastructure, interacted with our team, and had insightful discussions around our strategy to support high-potential startups working in deeptech startups

He also engaged with the SAMRIDH startup cohort, listening to their journeys and feedback on how the program is helping them build scalable, impactful ventures, with support from MeitY Startup Hub and the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology.

We’re excited to deepen our partnership and continue enabling early-stage startups with the resources, mentorship, and market access they need to succeed.

Looking forward to accelerating more digital-first, impact-driven innovations with MeitY Startup Hub!

🎯 Thank You, Mr. Jagan karthick! 🎯

We're thrilled to have hosted Mr. Jagan Karthick for a deep-dive workshop on #Design_Thinking — a session that empowered our startups to think empathetically, ideate boldly, and validate early.

With a structured walkthrough of the Design Thinking framework —

Empathize → Define → Ideate → Prototype → Test → Iterate
 — Jagan brought clarity on how to approach product development in a user-centric way.

The session featured powerful startup case studies — showing how design thinking drives real-world innovation.

Key takeaways also included:
 ✅ Strategies for early customer validation
 ✅ Brand differentiation for new markets
 ✅ A sneak peek into pre-incubation planning for low-engaged startups
Thank you, Jagan, for helping our founders sharpen their lens on problem-solving, positioning, and scaling with purpose. 🙌

#DesignThinking #StartupAcceleration #UserCentricInnovation #FounderMindset #DERBIFoundation #MentorshipMatters #InnovationJourney #EarlyStageStartups #ThankYou

Belagavi, Gets a Boost of AI Brilliance with its UNNATI AI workshop at KLE Academy of Higher Education and Research!

The UNNATI AI Workshop, organized by FITT, IIT Delhi in collaboration with Microsoft, was hosted at the KAHER Incubation and Innovation Foundation, KLE Academy of Higher Education and Research, Belagavi, Karnataka, brought together a dynamic ecosystem of students, startups, and innovators - all driven by the shared vision of transforming ideas into real-world AI solutions.

The highlight? FITT introduced its flagship UNNATI AI Accelerator, offering grant support of up to ₹30 Lakhs to selected innovators ready to scale impactful AI-based solutions.

Another key moment was the insightful session by ITTO (Innovation-Technology Transfer Office Foundation for Innovation Technology Transfer), which opened doors for participants to explore global pathways for deep tech commercialization and innovation transfer.

Special thanks to Dr. Preeti K. Doddwad, M.D.S., Professor, Dept. of Conservative Dentistry and Co-ordinator, KLE English Medium Schools, and Dr. Neha Dhaded, Associate Professor, KLE Vishwanath Katti Institute of Dental Sciences, for their support and coordination.

We extend our heartfelt appreciation to KIIF for hosting the FITT - IIT Delhi's team and for their integral role in the success of this collaborative initiative.

🔗 Want to be part of the UNNATI_AI accelerator?
 𝗔𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲: https://lnkd.in/dk-2hsjW

Work In Progress – July 2025 edition is here! 

This month, we spotlight innovation that shows up in many forms—quiet pilots, policy dialogues, and global collaborations. 

From linking biogas systems to global carbon markets to grassroots workshops on soil resilience, to deep-tech solutions making their mark across Southeast Asia, Europe, and the Middle East—this edition captures the steady convergence of ideas, communities, and systems. 

You’ll find start-ups shaping climate-resilient agriculture, ocean sustainability, dignified health access, and decentralised energy. You'll also see how IP milestones, field demos, and cross-sector partnerships are laying the foundation for future scale. 

Explore these stories of layered progress—and the people making it possible. 

Subscribe to receive future editions: https://lnkd.in/gw6bPWVh
   
Explore past editions: https://lnkd.in/gh4aF9cq  

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Smita Rakesh | Dr Kavita Singh | Neeraj Jain | Harish Hande 

#WorkInProgress #InvestedInImpact #InnovationForImpact

Innovators working on developing medical devices for screening and diagnosis often struggle with accessing funds for clinical trials and regulatory pathways. At this stage equity funding is almost non-existent.  (Sometimes it may be there but comes with extremely bad terms combined wifh hyper-dilution and horrific captables). 

This is where blended finance needs to be redefined. Capital providers need to understand that  de-risking early stage startups requires a continuum of capital where non dilutive and dilutive capital pools operate synchronously throughtout the product lifecycle depending upon the stage, complexity and market readiness of the innovations. This is not like a relay race where capital providers change roles but more like an orchestra where different pools can synchronise their risk underwriting and maximise the impact while creating value as the innovations transition from the lab to market.

#blendedfinance #valleyofdeath #impact #innovation  Social Alpha

In agriculture, productivity is only part of the story. 

Without efficient post-harvest systems, much of what’s grown is lost, or sold at distress prices. 

Farmers need access to infrastructure that preserves produce quality, extends shelf-life life, and enables value addition. For perishable crops, in particular, the time between harvest and sale is critical. 

We’re inviting start-ups developing solutions for: 

- Affordable, accessible preservation and processing 
- Modular storage with hybrid or passive cooling 
- Off-grid or decentralised post-harvest infrastructure 
- Quality monitoring, grading, and traceability 

Solutions should be relevant to smallholder farmers, and adaptable to a range of crops and geographies. 
 
Selected start-ups will receive funding, lab and design support, incubation, mentorship, and access to scale-up networks.
 
Applications close on 13th July 2025. Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony
 
#FarmingForward #PostHarvestInnovation #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture

https://www.linkedin.com/company/venture.text:
Ready-to-Use Labs, Offices, and Desks and much more at India's largest incubator for science and technology based startups! Come.... 𝗶𝗻𝗰𝘂𝗯𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝘂𝘀!

Venture Center is an award winning, leading incubator for deeptech, knowledge intensive startups, and our 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗜𝗻𝗰𝘂𝗯𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗴𝗿𝗮𝗺 for startups offers a range of benefits—without taking any equity!

1. World-Class Infrastructure

Access to state-of-the-art labs, fully equipped offices, and flexible desks. Our facilities are designed to meet the diverse needs of startups, providing everything you need to innovate and grow.

2. Expert Mentorship and Guidance

24/7 access to in-house expertise, in addition to customized one-on-one mentoring from industry veterans. 

3. Funding Opportunities

Access to seed funds, CSR funds, and government grants for different stages of your journey.

4. Prime Location

We are based in Pune, a city known for its thriving tech and innovation scene, and we are in close proximity to prestigious educational institutions and research centers. 

5. Comprehensive Ecosystem

Our extensive support network includes legal assistance, business development resources, regulatory and IP support, and access to workshops and events that provide valuable insights and networking opportunities. 

6. Vibrant peer group community on our campus

Surround yourself with like-minded innovators and entrepreneurs who can inspire and support your startup journey. 

𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗰𝘁 𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼𝗱𝗮𝘆! We're looking for startups with an innovative idea or technology in the early stages with a scalable business model!

I’m deeply honoured to be featured in “SHE IS: Women in Chemistry”, a celebration of 75 Indian women researchers who are shaping the future of science and innovation through their work.

This beautifully curated initiative—led by the Red Dot Foundation in collaboration with the Royal Society of Chemistry (UK) and the Office of the Principal Scientific Adviser to the Government of India—is a powerful reminder of the collective strength and brilliance of women in science. I’m sincerely grateful to the organisers for this recognition and for spotlighting stories that often go untold.

To be featured alongside such phenomenal scientists and innovators is not just a personal milestone—it is a moment of deep pride for our scientific community, and especially for every woman forging her path in STEM.
To every young girl with a dream: Dream Big! your curiosity matters, your voice matters, your science matters! The world needs you—now more than ever.

Here's to more voices being heard, more stories being told, and more barriers being broken!✨  
 

#WomenInScience #STEM #InclusionInSTEM #Cygenica #WomenInChemistry #ScienceLeadership #Innovation

Spinouts simplified for researchers and academic professionals! What does it really take to turn your research into a venture that makes a difference?

Join us at Venture Center for an engaging session with Dr. Premnath, as he unpacks the realities (and myths) of building spinouts from academic research. 

𝗔𝘀 𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗽𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗲𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗜𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗮 in spinning off ventures from publicly funded research and as the first incubator in the CSIR network, Venture Center brings deep, first-hand experience to this space — and who better to learn from than Dr. Premnath Venugopalan, who has mentored and led the creation of numerous spinouts over the past decade.

Expect practical insights, stories from the trenches, and a chance to explore how your ideas can move beyond publications and patents to create real-world impact.

If you’ve been considering the spinout path or are curious about where to begin, we would love to see you there.  

Event Details:
 🗓️ 15 July 2025
 🕒 3:00 PM – 4:00 PM
 📍 Venture Center
Registrations are now open: https://lnkd.in/d7wRKwPR

Over the past two weeks, VentureStudio hosted two engaging events that brought together students, makers, and founders from across the ecosystem.

We began with a hands-on 3D Printing Workshop at DST Prayas Shala, where participants explored the fundamentals of additive manufacturing, from basic design principles to operating a 3D printer. Attendees created their own prototypes and gained practical exposure to tools that enable rapid innovation. 

This was followed by a powerful panel discussion on "Building Startup Teams and Company Culture," featuring founders who’ve built successful ventures across sectors. Dr. Purav Gandhi (Healthark), Aenik Shah (Wizzy.ai), Abhishek Acharya (Theka Coffee), Shalin (Shawn) Parikh (MYCPE ONE), Shrijay Sheth (LegalWiz.in) and Jatin Chaudhary (eChai Ventures) shared hard-earned insights on hiring, values, and leadership. The room was filled with students, early-stage entrepreneurs, and professionals eager to learn what it really takes to build cohesive, high-performing teams.

Thank you to all the speakers and participants for making these sessions impactful. Stay tuned for more events from VentureStudio.

#Innovation #Entrepreneurship #3DPrinting #StartupCulture #AhmedabadUniversity #StartupIndia #DesignToPrototype #Founders #TeamBuilding
